description:
Sales Manager - East Coast Region (Hybrid)

My client is a leading innovator in the audiology medical device industry, looking for a highly motivated and results-oriented Sales Manager to join their dynamic team. In this critical role, you will play a key part in driving regional sales growth and fostering a collaborative and high-performing sales environment.

About The Company

They are dedicated to developing and providing cutting-edge solutions that empower individuals with hearing loss to live richer, more connected lives. Their diverse portfolio of evidence-based products is designed to enhance communication and improve overall quality of life.

The Opportunity

This position offers an exceptional opportunity to contribute to the success of a rapidly growing healthcare technology company.

As a Sales Manager, you will:
• Develop and implement strategic sales plans for the assigned territory, exceeding ambitious revenue targets.
• Recruit, onboard, and coach a high-performing team of sales representatives, fostering a culture of continuous learning and development.
• Conduct performance reviews and provide ongoing coaching, mentorship, and professional development opportunities for your team members.
• Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders within the audiology community, including audiologists, ENT specialists, and healthcare institutions.
• Develop and deliver impactful sales presentations and training programs to internal and external audiences.
• Stay abreast of industry trends and competitor landscapes, identifying and capitalizing on market opportunities.
• Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams across marketing, product development, and customer service to ensure consistent messaging and a seamless customer experience.

Qualifications
• A minimum of five years of experience in medical device sales management, preferably within the audiology or ENT space.
• Proven track record of exceeding sales targets and achieving business objectives in a fast-paced environment.
• Strong leadership and coaching skills with the ability to motivate, inspire, and develop a high-performing team.
• Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, demonstrating the ability to build and maintain strong relationships with diverse stakeholders.
• In-depth understanding of the audiology market and customer needs, with a passion for the positive impact hearing solutions can have on individuals' lives.
• Proficiency in CRM software, sales automation tools, and other relevant technology platforms.
• Ability to travel within the East Coast territory as required.

Benefits

My client offers a comprehensive benefits package, including:
• Competitive salary and bonus potential
• Generous vacation and paid time off policy
• Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans
• 401(k) retirement savings plan with company matching contribution
• Flexible work environment with a hybrid model offering 1-2 days in the office per week and the opportunity to work remotely within the East Coast region.

If you're interested in the above role, then please click apply.

Consult will endeavour to contact candidates within 14 days of application. However, if you do not hear back after 2 weeks then please assume on this occasion, unfortunately, you have not been successful.
